content.description: Start on a pockets on the right side of the south face, and pop to a big jug, then mantle over the top. A fun short problem worth doing.
content.location: south face of the marathon boulder.

content.description:
Climb okayish rock to nice pockets on the inside of the west face. From the nice pockets, begin traversing rightward towards an arete to top out on.

Weave through the obstacles of this climb for completion. Watch out for obstacles on the way down if you fall.
content.protection:
Don't top out straight up the pockets, head right to the arete for more solid rock.

A little PG, but a pad and a spotter make this one relatively safe.
content.location: west face of the marathon boulder. Start on the flat ground to the left of a small boulder.

content.description: Sit start very low on the South face of the Marathon boulder, a weird back flag sloper move off the ground gets you to a decent jug - then traverse into "One Hurdle" and top out there. Super fun!
content.location: low on the south face of the marathon boulder, just right of the slabby feature.

content.description: A long link-up starting on Floor Yoga, and ending at the finish of 13.1. Probably clocks in more around 12a, but it's bouldering.
Start on crimps just below the lip on the left side of the traverse. Pop up to the lip and start traversing right until you can mantle easily at the end of the lip. The faster you go the easy it is.
content.protection: pad over the one potential hazard boulder in the middle of the traverse.
content.location: East side of the Marathon boulder, Start on the south east side with the two crimps below the lip.
